cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV. 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with subword segmentation, which is a common technique used in natural language processing (NLP) tasks such as machine translation. Additionally, the paper mentions improving translation quality, which is a key task in NLP. 

It is also likely to belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) as the paper proposes a subword regularization method for improving machine translation performance. 

cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is another likely sub-category as the paper deals with improving the performance of a specific AI task (machine translation) through a novel technique. 

cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is a possible sub-category as the paper mentions using neural networks for machine translation and improving their performance through subword regularization. 

Finally, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is a less likely sub-category as the paper does not explicitly mention computer vision or image processing, but it does mention using BPE-dropout to improve the robustness of the model to segmentation errors, which could be relevant to image processing tasks that involve segmentation.
